alert.note: Alert for Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 19 at 2:40PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring. * WHERE...Kobuk River at the Village of Kobuk. * WHEN...Until 215 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying roads is occurring. Water will likely rise over the next day and flooding will get worse. Moderate flooding is expected and it is possible that homes in low lying areas could flood. Large blocks of ice could push onshore near the river bank. Water will remain high until the ice jam releases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 PM AKDT, Residents reported an ice jam formed on the Kobuk River near Kobuk Village on Thursday and is causing minor flooding of low lying roads. The ice jam remains in place. With additional snowmelt this weekend water levels will continue to rise behind this ice jam. Flooding will continue to get worse over the weekend until the ice jam breaks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along Kobuk River stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Take action now to prepare your community for flooding. Move valuable items to higher ground. Prepare to move people to higher ground on short notice as flooding gets worse.
